sen.j: 源 頼賢（みなもと の よりかた、生年未詳 - 保元元年7月30日 (旧暦)（1156年8月17日））は、平安時代末期の河内源氏の武将。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yorikata (date of birth unknown - August 17, 1156) was a Japanese military commander of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) who lived during the end of Heian period.
MINAMOTO no Yorikata (year of birth unknown - August 24, 1156) was a Japanese military commander of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) who lived during the end of the Heian period.

sen.e: He was in good terms with his second elder brother, MINAMOTO no Yoshikata, and said to have formed a pact of father and son.

sen.j: 久寿2年（1155年）、義賢が甥源義平に討ち取られると、その復仇を果たすべく信濃国に下向、鳥羽天皇領を侵犯する。
sen.e: When Yoshitaka was killed by his nephew, Yoshihira in 1155, he went down to Shinano Province to take revenge, and invaded Emperor Toba's territory.

sen.j: これを知った法皇は、義平の父で頼賢の長兄にあたる源義朝に対して、頼賢追討の院宣を下す。
sen.e: On finding about this, the Clositered Emperor gave a command to MINAMOTO no Yoritomo who was the father of Yoshihira and his eldest brother, to hunt down and kill Yoritaka.
On finding about this, the Clositered Emperor gave a command to MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo who was the father of Yoshihira and Yorikata's oldest brother, to hunt down and kill Yoritaka.
sen.cmt: MINAMOTO no Yoritomo→MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo、his eldest brother→Yorikata's oldest brotherに修正しました。
sen.e: On finding about this, the Clositered Emperor gave a command to MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo who was the father of Yoshihira and Yorikata's oldest brother, to hunt down and kill Yoritaka.

sen.j: これにより、河内源氏一族内に緊張が高まったが、直前で義朝は頼賢追討を回避、頼賢もほどなく帰京した。
sen.e: Due to this command, tensions in the Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) family ran high; but just before hunting down and killing Yoritaka, Yoritomo sidestepped, and Yoritaka returned to Kyoto shortly afterward.
Due to this command, tensions in the Kawachi-Genji family ran high; but just before hunting down and killing Yorikata, Yoshitomo sidestepped, and Yorikata returned to Kyoto shortly afterward.
sen.cmt: Kawachi-Genji→既出のため補足削除、Yoritaka→Yorikata、Yoritomo→Yoshitomoに修正しました。
sen.e: Due to this command, tensions in the Kawachi-Genji family ran high; but just before hunting down and killing Yorikata, Yoshitomo sidestepped, and Yorikata returned to Kyoto shortly afterward.

sen.j: 保元の乱では為義に従い、崇徳天皇・藤原頼長方として活躍。
sen.e: He served for Tameyoshi during the Hogen War, and took an active part on the side of Emperor Sutoku and FUJIWARA no Yorinaga.

sen.e: The manner in which he struggled against the army of Yoshitomo is described vividly in "Hogen Monogatari" (The Tale of the Hogen War).

sen.e: Due to the defeat on the side of the retired Emperor Sutoku, he was captured after the war, and was beheaded at Mt. Funaoka (Kita Ward, Kyoto City [Kyoto City]) by Yoshitomo.
